title: Keplers third law - two planetary systems

content.question: Planet <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> is in a circular orbit around Star <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, and Planet <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> is in a circular orbit around Star <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>. The radius of Planet <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>’s orbit is twice the radius of Planet <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>’s orbit, and the period of Planet <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>’s orbit is twice the period of Planet <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>’s orbit. Which of the following is closest to the ratio of the mass of Star <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> to the mass of Star <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
